page.title: 01INTRODUCTORY PAGE
page.content: The majority of our area is owned by the{Northumberland Estates.}Land which is not owned by the Duke includes a small area of private houses on the outskirts of Alnwick and the roads and railway which were bought by compulsory purchase order.Most of the area is arable farmland.The farms are called{Golden Moor,Quarry House, {Waterside House,Snableazes,Hawkhill, {and Alndyke.} There have been few changes in the area since the 17th century.There is a small Estate village called {Denwick}where there have been cottages since before 1620 when the earliest existing map of the area was made.It has a small 19th century church.A building of historical interest is the {Folly on Ratcheugh Crag,}built by the first Duke.
